programme.title: Inside...: Inside the Center of Islamic Civilization
programme.desc: The Center for Islamic Civilization in Tashkent stands at the intersection of culture, history, and faith. It's a place where Uzbekistan's rich intellectual and artistic heritage meets the possibilities of the future. Through conversations with scholars, curators, and craftspeople, we see how an idea conceived nearly a decade ago has grown into a national center dedicated to rediscovering the spirit of the Islamic Golden Age. programme.title: More Than A Game: Abu Dhabi
programme.desc: We explore how Abu Dhabi has rapidly transformed itself into one of the world's premier hubs for mixed martial arts. We trace the emirate's journey from building grassroots programs and training centers to hosting global events and forging landmark partnerships with organizations like the UFC. Through local fighters, coaches, and industry voices, we reveal how the sport has evolved from niche to mainstream, shaping new opportunities, and inspiring young athletes.

programme.desc: We explore how Abu Dhabi has rapidly transformed itself into one of the world's premier hubs for mixed martial arts. We trace the emirate's journey from building grassroots programs and training centers to hosting global events and forging landmark partnerships with organizations like the UFC. Through local fighters, coaches, and industry voices, we reveal how the sport has evolved from niche to mainstream, shaping new opportunities, and inspiring young athletes.

programme.title: Inside Africa: Inside Africa LIAFR715
programme.desc: Inside Africa takes its viewers on a journey across Africa, exploring the true diversity and depth of different cultures, countries and regions.

programme.title: CNN This Morning Weekend: Sunday, December 21, 2025 7AM
programme.desc: Start your day with Victor Blackwell bringing you the latest headlines and analysis.

programme.title: Inside Politics With Manu Raju: Sunday, December 21, 2025 8AM
programme.desc: Manu Raju leads an in-depth conversation on the week's most important political storylines, with a diverse set of analysts and news-making interviews.

programme.title: State of the Union with Jake Tapper and Dana Bash: Sunday, December 21, 2025 9AM
programme.desc: Jake Tapper and Dana Bash bring together major newsmakers, analysts and experts to tackle pressing domestic issues and diplomacy on the global stage.

programme.desc: When the 'Heart Eyes Killer' strikes, a pair of co-workers are mistaken for a couple by the elusive couple-hunting killer.(n)

programme.title: COMPANION
programme.desc: When Iris realizes that she is an AI companion for her boyfriend, she must embrace who she is and fight to survive in a battle for ultimate control.(n)

programme.title: Y2K
programme.desc: On the last night of 1999, two high school juniors crash a New Years Eve party, only to find themselves fighting for their lives.(n)

programme.title: ROB PEACE
programme.desc: The true story of Robert Peace who grew up in New Jersey, the son of a convicted murderer, and defied the odds and went to Yale on a full scholarship. But at age 30, his bright future was ended by the bullet of a rival gang dealer.(n)

programme.title: UP IN THE AIR
programme.desc: George Clooney is Ryan Bingham, a corporate downsizing expert whose cherished life on the road is threatened.(n)

programme.title: DREAMGIRLS
programme.desc: Three aspiring performers discover that the path to superstardom is strewn with obstacles and difficult decisions. Stars Jamie Foxx and Beyonce Knowles.(n)

programme.title: HOLLYWOOD ON SET S1
programme.desc: Each week Hollywood On Set goes behind-the-scenes on three major movies in production, featuring action footage and interviews with filmmakers.(n)

programme.title: BLOOD DIAMOND
programme.desc: A smuggler, fisherman and reporter team up in search of a priceless pink diamond, a lost son and the dark story behind the diamond trade.(n)

programme.title: ARCADIAN
programme.desc: Paul and his twin teenage sons, Thomas and Joseph, have been living a half-life – tranquility by day and torment by night.(n)

programme.title: THE ADVENTURES OF TINTIN
programme.desc: Tintin and his friends go on an exciting treasure hunt.(n)

programme.title: THE TIME TRAVELER'S WIFE
programme.desc: Artist Clare Abshire shares a deep emotional bond with Henry De Tamble, a handsome librarian who travels involuntarily through time.(n)

programme.title: LAST BREATH
programme.desc: An emotionally charged action thriller of a commercial diver who after a freak accident is trapped on the bottom of the North Sea.(n)

programme.title: PARANORMAL ACTIVITY: THE GHOST DIMENSION
programme.desc: In this sixth chapter of the horror franchise, a new family moves into Katie and Kristi's former house and discovers an evil presence that begins to terrorise their lives.(n)

programme.title: JERSEY GIRL
programme.desc: When a successful publicist finds himself an unemployed single father back living with his dad in the suburbs, he learns to acknowledge what truly makes him happy.

programme.desc: A smuggler, fisherman and reporter team up in search of a priceless pink diamond, a lost son and the dark story behind the diamond trade.

programme.title: INTO THE WILD
programme.desc: A top student and athlete leaves his middle-class life to venture into Alaska, only to meet people who will eventually shape his values and life.

programme.desc: A villain's plans to steal the moon are foiled when he encounters the immense will of three little orphaned girls who look at him as a potential Dad.

programme.desc: Graduated from college and realizing it takes more than just a cappella to get by, the Bellas return to make music together one last time.

programme.desc: At the height of the industrial age, as America's cities go vertical for the first time, a Yale educated medical doctor and Olympic gold medalist turns his attention to toys.(n)

programme.desc: Crashed UFOs. Recovered alien entities. For decades, incredible claims have been made about an extraterrestrial presence on Earth—and the government has gone to great lengths to discredit them.

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island (S11)
programme.desc: While new discoveries across the island continue to invigorate the team, a dangerous storm threatens to shut down the entire operation.

programme.title: History's Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman (S2)
programme.desc: During World War II, the Nazis created specialised Death Camps for killing prisoners. At Sobibor, a group of Jews were forced to keep the camp operational, engineered a daring escape that saved many lives.

programme.title: Hazardous History With Henry Winkler (S1)
programme.desc: Ever taken medical advice from a cigarette commercial? There was a time when any and all 'cures' could be sold to the public indiscriminately.

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch (S1)
programme.desc: In this special episode, Brandon, Travis, and Erik review the learnings of the Beyond Skinwalker Ranch mission's first season, where Andy and Paul experienced High Strangeness throughout America.

programme.title: The Death Coast
programme.desc: With time running out, the team returns to Le Chameau for another attempt at its elusive stern. When a series of finds threatens to upend their plan, the team must make one final push.

programme.desc: Graves, tombs, cremations are respectful ways to provide the deceased with a resting place. Is it possible that some of these practices can preserve the soul for eternity? Or bring the dead back to life?

programme.title: Mysteries Unearthed With Danny Trejo (S1)

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)
programme.desc: Imagine a city where the commute requires a zip line, or a town crawling with some strange monkeys, and a spot that holds a waterfall that spews blood. We take a tour of the most unusual places in history.

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)
programme.desc: Some of history's most brilliant innovations are also the most bizarre. Like a fully functioning car that hovers in midair. Or clothing made out of everyone's favourite source of calcium.

programme.title: The Mega-Brands That Built The World (S2)
programme.desc: In the 1950s, rival electronics companies aim to make music portable for the first time ever. What follows is a decades-long rivalry that prompts the creation of iconic products.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.(n)

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Stories about people, stories about life. Intimate portraits of people from around Japan, each leading diverse lives while enriching lives of others.(n)

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Fall
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.(n)

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to sleep. Explore the unique culture behind them.(n)

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #6 Does this train go to Ikebukuro? / Find out how to ask if public transportation goes to your destination. Use the name of the place plus "ni ikimasu ka".(n)

programme.title: Culture Crossroads

programme.title: Design X Stories
programme.desc: Today's theme: Design Hunting in Oita. Oita prefecture in Kyushu is famed for its hot springs. Meet a dyer who uses that water, explore 300-year-old folk pottery, and see how art revitalizes a town.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Asia Insight
programme.desc: An in-depth look at the realities of Asia today -- a dynamic region which faces political, economic, cultural, and technological change.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: FRONTRUNNERS
programme.desc: Wildlife vet Saito Keisuke has worked with endangered raptors in Hokkaido for 30 years. He treats and releases the many birds injured by human activity, while also working to prevent such accidents.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Today's Close-Up
programme.desc: Dig deeper into current affairs. Cutting-edge information and critical analysis on important issues confronting Japanese lives.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk #173
programme.desc: Mimaki Toshiyuki is co-chair of Nihon Hidankyo, winner of the 2024 Nobel Peace Prize. He talks about surviving the Hiroshima bombing and the group's work to achieve a world without nuclear weapons.

programme.title: IMPACTS: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: The entire Earth is affected by climate change, occurring with a greater speed and scale than ever before. This program uses scientific data and the latest findings to raise awareness on its impact.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: We visit a terakoya, a school teaching reading and writing. Today the young students have come dressed in their finest, and are busy putting brush to paper to show off their calligraphy skills.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: Hip osteoarthritis causes severe pain and may require artificial hip joint surgery. A Japanese university and a company have developed a long-lasting artificial joint, offering hope to many patients.

programme.title: Trailblazers
programme.desc: A wide range of topics featuring Japanese culture and society are introduced.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.desc: Wang Yuan Wei knows what it's like to feel lost. He now offers children from overseas a safe place to call home, where they too can say tadaima.

programme.title: Japan's Top Inventions
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind renowned Japanese products alongside our reporter. This time: capsule beds.

programme.title: Japanology Plus
programme.desc: Deep dives into cultural phenomena with Peter Barakan, a bilingual British broadcaster based in Japan since 1974. Each time, Peter himself discovers something new about Japan.

programme.title: The Professionals

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE

programme.title: Design X Stories
programme.desc: Today's theme: Design Hunting in Oita. Oita prefecture in Kyushu is famed for its hot springs. Meet a dyer who uses that water, explore 300-year-old folk pottery, and see how art revitalizes a town.

programme.title: Let's Enjoy MATH with Barky the Dog
programme.desc: Children wish to share a cake, but are confused when Numbler cuts the cake into different shapes. Barky uses the basics of fractions and geometry to prove that the pieces are indeed equal.

programme.title: TAKE TECH
programme.desc: A program for upper primary to lower secondary school children to explore the everyday technologies all around them. Each episode takes a piece of familiar tech to find out what it does and how.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Japan's Iconic Truth
programme.desc: Time and Tide transcends time to detail extraordinary historical events in Japan and the world. Join NHK WORLD-JAPAN on a journey that reveals the truth behind some of the turning points of the past.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode looks at words related to mouth. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Higashinada Danjiri involves a parade of decorated floats, pulled by teams of veterans and ridden by young performers that lean out over the crowd. 32 districts take part with their own float.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE

programme.title: Spiritual Explorers
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a wide range of programs from news, current affairs, documentaries, etc. focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: Time-lapse Japan
programme.desc: A 140-year-old store sells delicate, hand-crafted Japanese confectionery. Traditional techniques present floral beauty in sweets, and the seasonal colors of Izumo are shown in time-lapse images.

programme.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science.

programme.title: DESIGN MUSEUM JAPAN
programme.desc: Kikuchi Atsuki (Graphic designer) is drawn to enamelware that reflects the creators' own instincts. He talks about the appeal of designs made and used by the same person.

programme.title: J-MELO
programme.desc: Join May J. for Japanese music! This week: Hamaura Ayano (a former Hello! Project artist who moved into acting and is now a solo singer) and BUDDiiS (a dance-and-vocal group with 10 unique members).

programme.title: Little Charo
programme.desc: Little Charo is an animation series about a Japanese dog who got lost in NY. "I want to see my owner again!" Charo starts his adventure back home. Season 2-15.

programme.title: Japanology Plus mini
programme.desc: Japan has 9 million vacant homes. We investigate the issue of vacant homes in Japan and see how they're being used creatively to promote population growth and regional revitalization.

programme.title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: Chichibu is a mountainous region with lots of natural beauty. Cats keep watch over a field of red spider lilies and even guide visitors through the mountains! We also meet a cat who lives at a shrine.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: ANIME MANGA EXPLOSION
programme.desc: How did DIGIMON grow from a simple handheld game into a dramatic anime across 25 years? Meet the creators and go behind the scenes of their latest project, DIGIMON BEATBREAK.

programme.title: The New Adventures of Rockie and Her Friends
programme.desc: Puppet action show for children. In a distant post-human future where surviving creatures have formed a community, new-breed dinosaur girl Rockie sets out on hilarious adventures with her schoolmates.

programme.title: u&i
programme.desc: This show for kids promotes a greater understanding for people with difficulties and helps develop empathy. With the help of two fairies, the main character thinks about what can be done to help.

programme.title: Somewhere Street
programme.desc: A unique walking-eye view of cities around the globe! Chat to the locals and enjoy encounters that only strolling the streets can bring.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Through the Kitchen Window
programme.desc: In a small mountain town of just five people, we visit the kitchen of Isogai Hamako, sharing in distinctive foodways and smiles along the way.

programme.title: Core Kyoto mini
programme.desc: In summer, children gather at the street corners where Jizo statues stand for lively festivities. People pray for the health and success of their children during this cornerstone of faith.

programme.title: Easy Japanese for Work
programme.desc: Today: recommending additional repairs. Wewalage Suneth Priyanka Fernando, from Sri Lanka, works as a mechanic. In a roleplay challenge, he recommends additional repairs in the interest of safety.

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Takasago Masami generates almost no plastic waste. Composting instead of plastic bags for food scraps, or doing dishes with a cloth instead of a disposable sponge; little ideas that are fun and easy.
